text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Syrian newspapers on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
SYRIA TIMES
- President Assad receives message from Iranian president, reviews bilateral issues with foreign minister Velayati.
- Big difference between France, Israel on Middle East peace.
- Israeli premier Netanyahu reiterates stand on settlement building.
- Israeli artillery pounds south Lebanese villages.
- Jordanians step up efforts to prevent Israeli exhibition.
- Report says wide areas of Arab land confiscated by Israelis.
- French President Chirac says train blast barbaric, terrorist act.
TISHREEN
- Higher council of investment approves new projects.
- Cabinet discusses at weekly session reports of services and economy.
- Syria's information minister Salman meets Abu Dhabi crown prince in Abu Dhabi.
- Gulf countries welcome Qatar's decision to freeze normalisation with Israel.
- Contacts between Israel's Labour and Likud parties to form a coalition government.
- Israeli envoy met secretly with King Hussein of Jordan.
AL-THAWRA
- Arab and international circles say Israeli premier choosing war instead of peace.
- French president says just peace in the region could not be guaranteed by force.
- Saudi Arabia welcomes outcome of Islamic information ministers meeting in Damascus.
- Egypt says peace impossible without full Israeli withdrawal from Golan.
AL-BAATH
- United Arab Emirates President Sheikh Zaid re-elected for five more years.
